meanings.definition: The act of portraying someone or something as evil or demonic.
meanings.sent1: The demonizations in the movie made the villain seem very scary.
meanings.sent2: The demonizations of the character in the story were exaggerated.
meanings.sent3: The demonizations of the cat in the children's book made it a funny character.
meanings.sent4: Her demonizations of the new student were so extreme, it was like she was creating a monster.
meanings.sent5: The demonizations of the haunted house made it the scariest place in town.

meanings.definition: The process of making someone or something seem wicked or threatening.
meanings.sent1: The demonizations of the forest in the fairy tale made it a spooky place.
meanings.sent2: The politician's demonizations of his opponent were meant to sway public opinion.
meanings.sent3: The demonizations of the little puppy were so over-the-top, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: Her demonizations of the storm approaching painted it as a fierce enemy.
meanings.sent5: The demonizations of the old castle turned it into a forbidding fortress.

meanings.definition: The practice of vilifying or dehumanizing a person or group.
meanings.sent1: The demonizations of the rival team were meant to intimidate them.
meanings.sent2: The demonizations of certain communities only serve to create division.
meanings.sent3: The demonizations of the vegetables by the child were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her demonizations of the strict teacher turned him into a tyrant in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The demonizations of the peaceful protesters were completely unfounded.
